feed.subtitle: mathis is a journalist based in Berlin. Most of his work is on economics and how it relates to power. This website is a portfolio of work since 2015.

entry.title: DW -- Shoplifting on the rise in Germany

link.title: DW -- Shoplifting on the rise in Germany

entry.summary:
Some stories are easy but telling them is hard. Like shoplifting – numbers are up, experts and academic literature points to numbers rising usually when inflation is up. But how to tell that story visually? It took me four full business days to find a shopowner willing to talk on camera.

entry.title: DW -- Why Berlin's housing market is broken

link.title: DW -- Why Berlin's housing market is broken

entry.summary:
With finally new census data out, I took a deep dive into the numbers to confirm what experts have been saying about Berlin’s housing market for years: A couple of landlords own most of the city and its a renters’ city, giving landlords a lot of sway.
I looked at the numbers and filmed at a renters’ demonstration – pictures that were used in several news pieces as well.
